rice.description: Rice is a staple food crop grown primarily in Kharif season.
rice.climate: Warm and humid, above 25°C with rainfall over 100 cm.
rice.pests: Stem borers, leaf folders, brown planthopper

maize.description: Maize is a versatile cereal crop used for food and fodder.

millet.description: Millets are drought-resistant cereals grown in arid regions.
millet.climate: Warm, 25–30°C with low to moderate rainfall.

sugarcane.description: Sugarcane is a tropical crop used for sugar production.
sugarcane.climate: Hot and humid, 20–35°C with rainfall 85–165 cm.
sugarcane.soil: Well-drained alluvial, black, or red soils.
sugarcane.pests: Early shoot borer, top borer, white grub

cotton.description: Cotton is a fiber crop grown in Kharif season.

jute.description: Jute is a fiber crop known as 'golden fiber'.
jute.climate: Warm and humid, 25–35°C with 150–250 cm rainfall.

tea.description: Tea is a plantation crop grown in hilly regions.
tea.climate: Cool to warm, 20–30°C with 150–300 cm rainfall.
tea.soil: Loamy soil, acidic and rich in organic matter.
tea.pests: Tea mosquito bug, red spider mite

coffee.description: Coffee is a plantation crop grown in shaded areas.

soybean.description: Soybean is a major oilseed and protein-rich crop.

mustard.description: Mustard is a rabi oilseed crop grown in cooler climates.
mustard.soil: Loamy or sandy loam soil, well-drained.

barley.description: Barley is a cereal crop grown in rabi season.

sorghum.description: Sorghum is a drought-tolerant cereal crop.
sorghum.soil: Sandy loam to loamy soil, well-drained.

bajra.description: Bajra (pearl millet) is a hardy cereal crop.
bajra.climate: Hot and dry, 25–35°C with 40–50 cm rainfall.
bajra.soil: Sandy loam to shallow black soil.

ragi.description: Ragi (finger millet) is a nutritious cereal crop.
ragi.climate: Cool to warm, 20–30°C with 50–100 cm rainfall.
ragi.soil: Red, black, sandy, or loamy soils.

turmeric.description: Turmeric is a spice crop grown for its rhizomes.
turmeric.climate: Warm and humid, 20–30°C with 150–250 cm rainfall.
turmeric.soil: Well-drained clayey loam or red loamy soil.
turmeric.pests: Rhizome fly, shoot borer, leaf roller

cardamom.description: Cardamom is a spice crop known as 'queen of spices'.
cardamom.climate: Cool and humid, 10–35°C with 150–400 cm rainfall.

black_pepper.description: Black pepper is a spice crop grown on vines.
black_pepper.climate: Warm and humid, 15–40°C with 200–300 cm rainfall.
black_pepper.soil: Rich in humus, red loam to sandy loam.
black_pepper.pests: Pollu beetle, top shoot borer, scale insects

coconut.description: Coconut is a tropical plantation crop.
coconut.climate: Warm and humid, 27°C with 100–250 cm rainfall.
coconut.pests: Rhinoceros beetle, red palm weevil, eriophyid mite

banana.description: Banana is a tropical fruit crop grown year-round.
banana.climate: Warm and humid, 26–30°C with 100–200 cm rainfall.

tomato.description: Tomato is a warm-season crop requiring 70–80 days to harvest.

wheat.description: Wheat is a winter cereal crop sown in rabi season.
wheat.soil: Clay loam or loamy soil, well-drained.

apple.description: Apple is a temperate fruit crop grown for its sweet and crisp fruits.

grape.description: Grapes are cultivated for fresh consumption and wine production.
grape.soil: Well-drained sandy loam to clay loam.
grape.pests: Grape berry moth, mealybugs, downy mildew

mango.description: Mango is a tropical fruit known as the 'king of fruits'.
mango.pests: Mango hopper, fruit fly, powdery mildew

papaya.description: Papaya is a tropical fruit crop with high nutritional value.

pineapple.description: Pineapple is a tropical fruit crop grown for its juicy fruits.

orange.description: Orange is a citrus fruit rich in vitamin C.

lemon.description: Lemon is a citrus fruit known for its sour taste.
lemon.pests: Citrus leaf miner, aphids, citrus canker

guava.description: Guava is a tropical fruit rich in vitamin C.

pomegranate.description: Pomegranate is a drought-tolerant fruit crop.

watermelon.description: Watermelon is a warm-season fruit crop.

muskmelon.description: Muskmelon is a sweet, aromatic fruit.

cucumber.description: Cucumber is a warm-season vegetable crop.

pumpkin.description: Pumpkin is a warm-season vegetable crop.

bottle_gourd.description: Bottle gourd is a climbing vegetable crop.
bottle_gourd.pests: Red pumpkin beetle, fruit fly, downy mildew

bitter_gourd.description: Bitter gourd is a tropical vegetable crop.

okra.description: Okra is a warm-season vegetable crop.

brinjal.description: Brinjal (eggplant) is a warm-season vegetable crop.

chili.description: Chili is a spice crop grown for its pungent fruits.

onion.description: Onion is a cool-season vegetable crop.

garlic.description: Garlic is a cool-season bulb crop.

carrot.description: Carrot is a cool-season root vegetable.

radish.description: Radish is a cool-season root vegetable.

beetroot.description: Beetroot is a cool-season root vegetable.

spinach.description: Spinach is a cool-season leafy vegetable.

cauliflower.description: Cauliflower is a cool-season vegetable crop.

lettuce.description: Lettuce is a cool-season leafy vegetable.

pea.description: Pea is a cool-season legume crop.

chickpea.description: Chickpea is a cool-season legume crop.

lentil.description: Lentil is a cool-season legume crop.

cowpea.description: Cowpea is a warm-season legume crop.

asparagus.description: Asparagus is a perennial vegetable crop known for its tender shoots.

broccoli.description: Broccoli is a cool-season vegetable rich in vitamins.

brussels_sprouts.description: Brussels sprouts are a cool-season crop producing small cabbage-like heads.

cabbage.description: Cabbage is a leafy vegetable grown for its dense heads.

celery.description: Celery is a cool-season crop valued for its crisp stalks.

collard_greens.description: Collard greens are leafy vegetables popular in southern cuisines.
collard_greens.climate: Cool to warm, 15–25°C with full sun.

endive.description: Endive is a leafy green with a slightly bitter taste.

kale.description: Kale is a nutrient-rich leafy green vegetable.

leek.description: Leek is a mild-flavored allium grown for its edible stalk.

mustard_greens.description: Mustard greens are spicy leafy vegetables used in salads and cooking.

parsnip.description: Parsnip is a root vegetable with a sweet, nutty flavor.

rutabaga.description: Rutabaga is a root vegetable, a cross between cabbage and turnip.
rutabaga.pests: Cabbage root maggot, aphids, flea beetles

swiss_chard.description: Swiss chard is a leafy green known for its colorful stems.
swiss_chard.climate: Cool to warm, 15–25°C with full sun.

turnip.description: Turnip is a root vegetable grown for its edible roots and greens.

artichoke.description: Artichoke is a perennial thistle grown for its edible flower buds.

arugula.description: Arugula is a fast-growing leafy green with a peppery flavor.

bok_choy.description: Bok choy is a type of Chinese cabbage with crisp stalks.

chard.description: Chard is a leafy green vegetable with colorful stems.
chard.climate: Cool to warm, 15–25°C with full sun.

chicory.description: Chicory is a leafy vegetable with a slightly bitter taste.

fennel.description: Fennel is a flavorful herb with edible bulbs and fronds.
fennel.climate: Cool to warm, 15–25°C with full sun.

kohlrabi.description: Kohlrabi is a cool-season vegetable with a bulbous stem.

mizuna.description: Mizuna is a Japanese mustard green with a mild flavor.

pak_choi.description: Pak choi is a type of Chinese cabbage with tender leaves.

radicchio.description: Radicchio is a leafy vegetable with a bitter taste and red leaves.

salsify.description: Salsify is a root vegetable with a flavor resembling oysters.
